alert.note: Alert for Lauderdale; Lawrence (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 8:48AM CST until March 04 at 12:40PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Much of northwest Alabama, including the following counties, Colbert, Franklin AL, Lauderdale and Lawrence. * WHEN...Until noon CST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 846 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms that occurred overnight last night. Flooding is already occurring across Northwest Alabama, and additional rainfall will exacerbate ongoing and lingering flooding. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen overnight, with an additional inch to 1.5 inches possible today. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Decatur, Florence, Muscle Shoals, Russellville, Sheffield, Tuscumbia, Moulton, Red Bay, Trinity, Rogersville, Phil Campbell, Killen, Town Creek, Cherokee, Littleville, Lexington, Leighton, Courtland, St. Florian and Underwood- Petersville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
